A block is placed on a rough floor and a horizontal force 'F' is applied on it. The force of friction 'f' by the floor on the block is measured for different values of 'F'. The graph between the 'f' and 'F' would be
options: The graph is a straight line of slope 45° for all 'F'
The graph is a straight line parallel to 'F' axis for all 'F'
The graph is a straight line of slope 45° for small values of 'F' and straight line parallel to 'F' axis for large 'F'
The graph is exponential with values of 'F'
correctAnswer: The graph is a straight line of slope 45° for small values of 'F' and straight line parallel to 'F' axis for large 'F'

question: Throughout the flight of a particle in projectile motion
options: The horizontal component of velocity is constant
The vertical component of velocity is constant
The horizontal component of velocity decreases
The horizontal component of velocity is zero
correctAnswer: The horizontal component of velocity is constant

Which of the following statements is wrong?
options: Surface Tension of a liquid decreases with increase of temperature
Surface Tension of a liquid increases or decreases depending on the type of impurities added to the liquid
Angle of Contact depends on the inclination of the solid rod placed in the liquid
A drop of oil placed on the surface of water will spread as a thin layer
correctAnswer: Angle of Contact depends on the inclination of the solid rod placed in the liquid

In LASER, the condition of Population Inversion mean
options: The number of atoms in the lower energy state are more than the higher energy state.
The number of atoms in the higher energy state are more than the lower energy state.
The number of atoms in the lower and higher energy states are same.
The number of atoms in higher energy state are zero.
correctAnswer: The number of atoms in the higher energy state are more than the lower energy state.

question: In a Graded Index Optical Fibre
options: The Refractive Index of the core remains constant and will be greater than that of the cladding.
The Refractive Index of the core remains constant and will be less than that of the cladding.
The Refractive Indices of both core and cladding remain constant and are equal.
The Refractive Index of the core varies with maximum at the centre and decreases as the radial distance increases from the axis of the core.
correctAnswer: The Refractive Index of the core varies with maximum at the centre and decreases as the radial distance increases from the axis of the core.

question: Which of the following statements is correct, if ne and nh are the concentrations of the Electrons and Holes respectively
options: In an intrinsic semiconductor, ne = nh and both these charge carriers contribute to current equally
In p-type semiconductor, ne > nh and the current due to electrons is more than that of holes
In n-type semiconductor, np > ne and current due to holes is more than that of electrons
In an extrinsic semiconductor, ne = nh and both these charge carriers contribute to current equally
correctAnswer: In an intrinsic semiconductor, ne = nh and both these charge carriers contribute to current equally

Choose the correct option that differentiates metals from non-metals
options: Metals form acidic oxides, whereas non-metals form basic oxides.
Metals have a tendency to gain electrons, whereas non-metals have a tendency to lose electrons.
Metals are generally good conductors of electricity, whereas non-metals are insulators.
All metals exist in a solid state at room temperature.
correctAnswer: Metals are generally good conductors of electricity, whereas non-metals are insulators.

question: Nichrome is commonly used in heating elements because
options: It has a high melting point and corrosion resistance
correctAnswer: It has a high melting point and corrosion resistance

On receiving an interrupt from an I/O device, the CPU
options: Hands over control of address bus and data bus to the interrupting device
Branches off to the interrupt service routine immediately
Branches off to the interrupt service routine after completion of the current instruction
correctAnswer: Branches off to the interrupt service routine after completion of the current instruction

options: Refers to a computer system capable of processing several programs at the same time
Represents organization of single computer containing a control unit, processor unit and a memory unit
Includes many processing units under the supervision of a common control unit
Includes many processing units with non-shared memory
correctAnswer: Includes many processing units under the supervision of a common control unit
